title: What are the best Google calendar hacks? - Quora
tags: Tips and Hacks for Everyday Life

response.answer_text: I recommend NoxMemory，NoxMemory uses a lot of gestures. Whether it's displaying the sidebar, creating a new event, setting the time, or switching the calendar, you can do most of the operation with just a side-slip, drop-down, click, etc. gesture. Besides, NoxMemory adds the Notification Center widget. According to the habits of personal use, you can freely combine desktop components, you can see recent event reminders without opening the app, and find time changes anytime, anywhere. Simply put, NoxMemory is a brilliant app that can serve as a home for your events and help you manage your calendar. Because of the different time views, there’s something for everyone within this app.

Synchronize your personal and professional calendars. This way you will avoid double bookings.To schedule appointments use Appoint.ly or some other scheduling tool. This way you will not waste time on sending back-and-forth emails - instead you will just send a link to your Appointly, and people will simply pick the time that fits them.Create new calendars for different parts of your life. You will be able to see them at the same time on the same calendar view, but they will have different colors, so it will be easy to know what they are at a glance.

Syncing it with other calendars is the most productive way to use it, in my opinion. Also, sharing it with others too. Those are great ways to utilize it because you not only are using your time wisely by having a plan, you’re helping others know your schedule by sharing your calendar with them. You are also saving yourself time by knowing everyone else’s schedules as well. I hope this answer was helpful! Thanks for your question.

Try Magneto Calendar. It syncs to Google Calendar and Exchange. 1. Predictive Travel times are added to your calendar.2. You can share a snapshot of your calendar with anyone.3. It has integrated smart to-dos4. It has a browser extension (Chrome and FF) that helps you add meetings to your calendar from any webpage in a click.5. It automatically blocks times for your personal meetings on your work calendar.It's free... Ping me if you want an invite.
